Intervention.evidence: 30 children belonging to the TXA group (intervention arm) received a loading dose of intravenous TXA 50 mg/kg over 10 minutes immediately after induction, followed by its infusion at 5 mg/kg/h. Thirty patients belonging to the normal saline (NS) group (control arm) received intravenous NS of the same volume, without any active drug.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the effect of TXA in reducing blood loss in nephrectomy for Wilms tumor

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary objective was to assess its effect on the amount of intraoperative blood loss.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 30 children belonging to the TXA group (intervention arm)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The TXA group has significantly lower intraoperative surgical blood (216.33 vs 306.33 mL; p=0.001).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were identified either intraoperatively or in the immediate postoperative period.
